analyzed: sde dpon / shing tin tu ka smin cing mchis kyi /

original: gsol du gshegs so //
analyzed: gsol du gshegs so //

analyzed: de nas sde dpon 'khor lnga brgya dang shing tin tu ka de la 'dzegs te shing tin tu ka la bza' bar brtsams so //

original: de nas srung ma'i mis ri brag na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas srung ma'i mis ri brag na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs la smras pa /
translated: Then the guards told the people living in the mountains,

analyzed: shes ldan dag /
translated: “Sirs,

analyzed: shing tin tu ka la spre'u thams cad 'dzegs nas za bar byed kyi /
translated: all the monkeys have climbed the tinduka tree and are eating the fruit.

analyzed: khyed cag gi bya ba'am byed pa gang yin pa de / gyis shig / de nas ri brag na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs lag na mda' gzhu dang dgra sta thogs /

analyzed: khu tshur bcangs te rings par song nas shing tin tu ka gcad par brtsams pa dang / de nas spre'u de rnams bred de mchong brgal zhing shing ka phan tshun rgyu bar byed do //
translated: The monkeys, terrified, jumped and ran from tree to tree.

original: sde dpon ni /
analyzed: sde dpon ni /
translated: The leader,

analyzed: sems las chung ngus za bar byed pa dang spre'u de rnams kyis de la smras pa /
translated: eating the fruit with little concern, was told by the monkeys,

analyzed: sde dpon / bdag cag ni /
translated: “Leader,

analyzed: khyod ci'i slad du thugs khral chung ngur bzhugs /

original: des tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: des tshigs su bcad de smras pa /

analyzed: bya ba mang po'i mi rnams la //

analyzed: bya ba min pa'ang de dang 'dra //

original: shing gi 'phro ni mang yod pas //
analyzed: shing gi 'phro ni mang yod pas //

original: sems las bskyungs te bza' bar gyis //
analyzed: sems las bskyungs te bza' bar gyis //

analyzed: de nas yang sde dpon gyi phru gu zhig ri brag de na bcings te 'dug pa de lag pa 'gram pa @218a *//

analyzed: la gtad nas /

analyzed: sems khong du chud cing 'dug pa dang / ji tsam na spre'u bzang po zhig phyogs der 'ongs pa dang / de sems khong du chud pa mthong nas smras pa /

analyzed: grogs po / ci'i phyir lag pa 'gram pa la gtad nas sems khong du chud /

analyzed: da ltar ri brag na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs thams cad kho bo'i nye du gsod du dong na /

analyzed: ci'i phyir sems khong du chud par mi 'gyur /

original: ci'i phyir khyod kyis pha rol gnon pa ma byas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khyod kyis pha rol gnon pa ma byas /
translated: Why didn’t you defeat them?”

original: bcings na / ji ltar pha rol gnon par bya /
analyzed: bcings na / ji ltar pha rol gnon par bya /
translated: “If they were bound, how could I defeat them?”

original: kho bos khyod dgrol lo //
analyzed: kho bos khyod dgrol lo //
translated: “I will free you.”

original: zhes des de bkrol ba dang / de nas des ri brag der me btang ste ri brag kun tshig pas /
analyzed: zhes des de bkrol ba dang / de nas des ri brag der me btang ste ri brag kun tshig pas /

analyzed: ca co dang / ku co'i sgra chen po byung ba de rnams kyis thos nas sdangs te smras pa /
translated: When the people heard the great sound of wailing and crying, they were frightened and said,

original: shes ldan dag /
analyzed: shes ldan dag /
translated: “Sirs,

original: bdag cag dang / spre'u rnams ni /
analyzed: bdag cag dang / spre'u rnams ni /

original: thag ring po kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: thag ring po kho na yin gyi /

analyzed: phung po chen po gzhan 'di byung ste ri brag bsregs kyi /

original: me gsad kyi /
analyzed: me gsad kyi /
translated: Let us put out the fire

original: slar ldog go /
analyzed: slar ldog go /
translated: and return.”

analyzed: zhes de rnams me gsad pa'i phyir rgyugs pa dang / spre'u rnams kyang shing tin tu ka las babs nas bros so //
translated: They ran to put out the fire, and the monkeys also descended from the tinduka tree and fled.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: spre'u'i phru gu gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: spre'u'i phru gu gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The young monkey

original: sh'akya rgan po 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: sh'akya rgan po 'di nyid yin te /
translated: was this old man of the Śākya clan.

original: de na yang 'dis nye du la chags pas ri brag bsregs la /
analyzed: de na yang 'dis nye du la chags pas ri brag bsregs la /
translated: At that time, too, he burned a mountain forest out of attachment to his relatives.

original: da ltar yang 'dis nye du la chags pas ri brag bsregs so //
analyzed: da ltar yang 'dis nye du la chags pas ri brag bsregs so //
translated: And now, too, he burned a mountain forest out of attachment to his relatives.”

analyzed: nag po'i grong khyer du gshegs nas nag po'i grong khyer du sangs rgyas bzhi'i gdan zhes bya ba rgyas par gong ma bzhin du'o //
translated: The Buddha went to the city of Kāliṅga, and in the city of Kāliṅga, he sat on the seat of the four buddhas.

analyzed: ro hi ta @218b kar byon nas ro hi ta ka na gnod sbyin glang chen stobs kyi gnas na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha went to Rohitaka and stayed in the abode of the yakṣa Hastin in Rohitaka.

original: de'i tshe gnod sbyin glang chen stobs /
analyzed: de'i tshe gnod sbyin glang chen stobs /
translated: At that time, the yakṣa Hastin

analyzed: gnod sbyin rnams kyi gnod sbyin gyi mdun sar song ba dang / gnod sbyin glang chen stobs kyis /
translated: went to the assembly of the yakṣas, and the yakṣa Hastin

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bskyed par byon nas ro hi ta ka na bdag gi gnas kho na na bzhugs so // zhes thos so //
translated: heard that the Blessed One had come and was staying in his very own abode in Rohitaka.

original: thos nas kyang /
analyzed: thos nas kyang /
translated: Having heard that,🔽he went to the Blessed One, and after approaching him, he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet, circumambulated the Blessed One three times, and sat to one side.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga na ba der song ste phyin pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga na ba der song ste phyin pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: He went to the Blessed One, and upon his arrival, he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and then sat down to one side.

analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gnod sbyin glang chen stobs la /

translated: a discourse on the Dharma that was instructive,🔽engaging, and delightful,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das do mod bdag gi gnas su bzhugs par gnang bar mdzad du gsol //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnod sbyin glang chen stobs la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to the yakṣa Hasty by remaining silent.

original: de nas gnod sbyin glang chen stobs kyis /
analyzed: de nas gnod sbyin glang chen stobs kyis /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyir gtsug lag khang lnga brgya sprul te /

analyzed: stan nang tshangs can dang / sngas nang tshangs can dang / gor bu lnga brgya @219a *//

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun thabs gcig tu sang bdag gi sdum par gdugs tshod sbyor zhing mchis na /

original: gnang bar mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: gnang bar mdzad du gsol //
translated: Please grant me this.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnod sbyin glang chen stobs la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnod sbyin glang chen stobs la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to the yakṣa Hasty by remaining silent.

original: de nas gnod sbyin glang chen stobs kyis /
analyzed: de nas gnod sbyin glang chen stobs kyis /
translated: Then the yakṣa Hasty

translated: He ordered his friend, the Gandhāran yakṣa Rāvaṇa,

analyzed: kho bos sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod la spyan drangs kyi /

analyzed: byang phyogs kyi 'bras bu rnams skur cig /
translated: Send me fruits from the north.”

original: ces des pho nya btang nas /
analyzed: ces des pho nya btang nas /
translated: He sent a messenger.

analyzed: de nyid kyi mtshan mo nas gtsang zhing bsod pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag sta gon byas nas nang par sngar langs te gtsug lag khang chag chag dang phyag dar byas nas gdan bshams te nor bu'i chu snod bzhag nas khang skyong gis gand'i brdungs pa dang
translated: That night he prepared pure, fine food and drink. The next morning he rose early, swept the temple, arranged seats, set out jeweled water pots, and had the temple supervisor ring the gavel.

analyzed: / gnod sbyin sgra sgrog gis rgun 'brum gyis skon pa bkang ste /

original: gnod sbyin rnams kyi lag tu bskur te /
analyzed: gnod sbyin rnams kyi lag tu bskur te /

analyzed: de dag gis gtsug lag khang gi dbus su phung por spungs te bzhag go /
translated: They piled the fruit in the center of the temple.🔽The monks did not know what the fruit was or how to examine it, so they asked the Blessed One.

translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

analyzed: byang phyogs kyi nags kyi 'bras bu rgun 'brum zhes bya ste /
translated: these are grapes, a fruit from the northern forests.

original: mes brtag pa byos la rims shig /
analyzed: mes brtag pa byos la rims shig /
translated: Examine them with fire and eat them.”

original: dge slong rnams 'brum bu re re nas byed pa dang / shin tu yun ring du thogs par gyur nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams 'brum bu re re nas byed pa dang / shin tu yun ring du thogs par gyur nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: phung po gnyis sam gsum du byos la mes reg par byos shig /

analyzed: de nas gnod sbyin glang chen stobs kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bde bar bzhugs par rig nas /
translated: Then the yakṣa Elephant Power, knowing that the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks were comfortable,

analyzed: gtsang zhing bsod pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag rang gi lag nas zhes bya ba nas stan ches dma' ba zhig blangs te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug go / zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin du'o //
translated: When the Blessed One had finished his meal, he got up from his seat and departed.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnod sbyin glang chen stobs la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with a talk about the Dharma, instructed, inspired, encouraged, and delighted the yakṣa Hastaka.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: He instructed, inspired, encouraged, and delighted him with a talk about the Dharma.🔽Then the Blessed One got up from his seat and departed.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs pa dang / rgun 'brum mang du lhag par gyur nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs pa dang / rgun 'brum mang du lhag par gyur nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: There was a great deal of grape juice left over, and the Blessed One said,

analyzed: rgun 'brum rnams mnyes la khu ba brim par bya'o //
translated: “Press the grapes and distribute the juice.”

original: 'on kyang lhag nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang lhag nas /
translated: But there was still more left over,🔽and the Blessed One said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽🔽

original: dro 'jar byas te bzhag pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dus ma yin pa'i btung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dro 'jar byas te bzhag pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dus ma yin pa'i btung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and then left it to cool.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol tu zhabs gnyis bkrus nas gtsug lag khang du nang du yang dag 'jog gi phyir zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol tu zhabs gnyis bkrus nas gtsug lag khang du nang du yang dag 'jog gi phyir zhugs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One washed his feet outside the monastery and entered the monastery for solitary meditation.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs @220a *//🔽te / nga ni tshe thung ngu'i dus la byung bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus la bab na /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs @220a *// te / nga ni tshe thung ngu'i dus la byung bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus la bab na /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought this:

original: gdul ba'i don bya ba ni /
analyzed: gdul ba'i don bya ba ni /
translated: “I have appeared in an age of short lifespans, and the time has come for me to pass into nirvāṇa.🔽There are many beings to be trained,

original: rab tu mang bas gal te nga dge slong kun dga' bo dang thabs gcig tu byang phyogs su gshegs na ni /
analyzed: rab tu mang bas gal te nga dge slong kun dga' bo dang thabs gcig tu byang phyogs su gshegs na ni /
translated: and if I go north with the monk Ānanda,

original: gdul ba rnams kyi don bya dka' bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gdul ba rnams kyi don bya dka' bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: it will be difficult to benefit those to be trained.

analyzed: ma lang nga gnod sbyin lag na rdo rje dang lhan cig gshegs par bya'o //
